title: @Riot Since the Precision Tree has 4 main runes, can we expect more runes for other Rune Trees?
body: Something that I been thinking about recently after the release of conquer rune.

replies.body: Could be. We don't have specific 'goal' for how many runes should be in a slot (the answer is like 'however many the Path/slot needs to serve its audiences well or make an interesting choice') so it's very possible that we see 4 runes in a slot in other places and Paths.
Okay, thank you for your response.

Cant wait to see the domination tree and inspirations tree 4th keystone. For me i have yet to find one that fits me, but thats because i spent 1k games on jayce with the same runes/keystone/items in season 7. So now i dont know what to take.

I have made a few threads about concepts of new runes (mostly non-keystones). I always try to think of new ways to make League interesting, it makes me giddy when I see systemic changes or when a champion gets a new effect, as well as brand new champion releases and VGUs. I'm hoping that Riot takes a look at these and possibly use a modified version of some of them or gain inspiration from my ideas (as well ideas from someone who commented on mine). It would mean so much to me if a Rioter would take a look at them, I just never know who/which Rioter to @ at :)

if they feel the need i guess? but adding more just for kicks doesn't sound good so maybe later on? though unpopularopinion: I'm hoping for another rune rework with less utilities that unbalance the game.

At this point I think all the keystones are in a fairly balanced spot. All are equally impactful now and every single one is being utilized by more than 1 champion.

I wouldn't mind a Predator nerf though, it's a bit ridiculous.

i don't feel comfortable with the idea that champions need to be made and balanced around an outside utility function that's separate from their kits. It if was just stats then you can just readjust the champions numbers but not utility, what some breaks some need it to function and then it becomes a pickle.
Yes the goal is 4 runes in each branch. Of course this is not a promised feature, but that was a loose goal they gave a while back.
Oh, I wasn't aware of that lol. Thanks.

I don’t think it’s a specific goal. I remember Riot saying it’s possible that they could have 5 keystones in one tree, while only having 3 in others if it worked out for balance. So basically they’ll make more as they need them, but won’t go out of their way just to make it even.
